fields.label: Patient name

groups.label: Date
• The local flap carries with it some native blood supply, so it can be designed with the best thickness to match the depth of the cancer defect.
• Skin colour and quality is also a good match for the defect site since the skin is transferred from immediately adjacent to the defect.
• Skin flaps may become infected or bleed like any other skin procedure.
• Occasionally the skin flap may breakdown. This results in prolonged healing time and can result in increased scarring.
• You will have some discomfort in the next 24-48 hours after the procedure. Take pain medication as prescribed by your doctor.
• It is common for the area around the surgery site to feel numb or hypersensitive to touch but should improve with time.
E.g. 2 Skin flap repair after excision of melanoma on scalp
Activities:
• Take things gently for 2 weeks to allow the skin flap to heal properly.
• The flap area is quite fragile, so it is important not to rub or brush against the graft or the dressing, or put pressure on the area.
• Bandage or tubigrip (elastic stocking) is applied to put pressure and to prevent swelling.
• If the skin flap is anywhere other than your leg(s), you can start walking as soon as you feel up to it.
• If the skin flap is on one or both of your legs, we encourage limited mobility for around 2 days or until the skin flap is secure enough for walking. Please elevate when resting.
• Avoid vigorous activities that require pushing, pulling, stretching or heavy lifting. Strenuous activity may cause bleeding particularly 24 -48 hours after surgery.
• You may need 3-4 weeks off work if you have had a skin flap to your leg.
• When the skin flap has healed properly you should be able to carry on with your normal activities.
Wound Infection:
If you experience any of the below, please get in contact with our team.
• Smelly discharge from dressing
• High temperature
• Increased pain
• Redness and swelling around the skin flap

fields.label: Date

The cutaneous (skin) flap is commonly used for repair or reconstruction of an open wound or a soft tissue deficit. It involves moving the skin (and potentially other soft tissues) from a donor site to the affected area. The skin flap maintains its own blood supply.

groups.label: • Local flaps have many advantages compared to skin grafts including better colour and contour match.
Skin flaps are most often used on the face.
• Having a skin flap means extra incisions are required, and they can sometimes be quite large. Every effort is made to camouflage these incisions by placing them in the natural skin lines.
E.g.1 Skin flap repair after excision of a basal cell carcinoma on the nose

Skin flaps are only used if the skin edge of the wound cannot be simply stitched together. Wounds can be left to heal by themselves or partially stitched but this may result in a more noticeable scar.
We normally like to see all patients who have had a skin flap 5-7 days after the operation. The stitches are usually removed and the doctor will check that there are no problems.

sections.name: What are the benefits of having a skin flap?

fields.label: • Local flaps have many advantages compared to skin grafts including better colour and contour match.
• The local flap carries with it some native blood supply, so it can be designed with the best thickness to match the depth of the cancer defect.
• Skin colour and quality is also a good match for the defect site since the skin is transferred from immediately adjacent to the defect.

sections.name: Where are skin flaps normally used?

fields.label: Skin flaps are most often used on the face.

sections.name: Risks or complications of a skin flap

fields.label: • Having a skin flap means extra incisions are required, and they can sometimes be quite large. Every effort is made to camouflage these incisions by placing them in the natural skin lines.
• Skin flaps may become infected or bleed like any other skin procedure.
• Occasionally the skin flap may breakdown. This results in prolonged healing time and can result in increased scarring.
• You will have some discomfort in the next 24-48 hours after the procedure. Take pain medication as prescribed by your doctor.
• It is common for the area around the surgery site to feel numb or hypersensitive to touch but should improve with time.

sections.name: What will the skin flap look like?

fields.label: E.g.1 Skin flap repair after excision of a basal cell carcinoma on the nose
E.g. 2 Skin flap repair after excision of melanoma on scalp

sections.name: What if I decide I don’t want a skin flap?

fields.label: Skin flaps are only used if the skin edge of the wound cannot be simply stitched together. Wounds can be left to heal by themselves or partially stitched but this may result in a more noticeable scar.
We normally like to see all patients who have had a skin flap 5-7 days after the operation. The stitches are usually removed and the doctor will check that there are no problems.
Activities:
• Take things gently for 2 weeks to allow the skin flap to heal properly.
• The flap area is quite fragile, so it is important not to rub or brush against the graft or the dressing, or put pressure on the area.
• Bandage or tubigrip (elastic stocking) is applied to put pressure and to prevent swelling.
• If the skin flap is anywhere other than your leg(s), you can start walking as soon as you feel up to it.
• If the skin flap is on one or both of your legs, we encourage limited mobility for around 2 days or until the skin flap is secure enough for walking. Please elevate when resting.
• Avoid vigorous activities that require pushing, pulling, stretching or heavy lifting. Strenuous activity may cause bleeding particularly 24 -48 hours after surgery.
• You may need 3-4 weeks off work if you have had a skin flap to your leg.
• When the skin flap has healed properly you should be able to carry on with your normal activities.
Wound Infection:
If you experience any of the below, please get in contact with our team.
• Smelly discharge from dressing
• High temperature
• Increased pain
• Redness and swelling around the skin flap

sections.name: If you need more information or have any concerns we are only a phone or email call away.
